intro: Biscutella sempervirens var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Its flowers are typically yellow or pale green, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is adapted to rocky and arid environments, showcasing resilience to harsh climatic conditions.
